com.qoppa.pdf.annotations

Interface Text

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Annotation

    public interface Text
extends Annotation
    Interface representing a Text annotation (also known as sticky note) in a PDF document. Text annotations are displayed as a note icon on the PDF document and open a text box to show its contents when double-clicked.
    Author:
    Qoppa Software

    • Method Detail

      • getIconName

        java.lang.String getIconName()
        Returns the name of the icon for this annotation. Should be one of:
        • Text.ICON_NOTE - This is the default
        • Text.ICON_COMMENT
        • Text.ICON_KEY
        • Text.ICON_HELP
        • Text.ICON_NEWPARAGRAPH
        • Text.ICON_PARAGRAPH
        • Text.ICON_INSERT
        • Text.ICON_CHECK
        • Text.ICON_CHECKMARK
        • Text.ICON_CIRCLE
        • Text.ICON_CROSS
        • Text.ICON_CROSSHAIRS
        • Text.ICON_RIGHT_ARROW
        • Text.ICON_RIGHT_POINTER
        • Text.ICON_STAR
        • Text.ICON_UP_ARROW
        • Text.ICON_UP_LEFT_ARROW
        Returns:
        Name of the icon.

      • isInitialOpen

        boolean isInitialOpen()
        Returns the value of the InitialOpen flag.
        Returns:
        Value of the flag.

      • setInitialOpen

        void setInitialOpen(boolean initOpen)
        Sets the initial open flag.
        Parameters:
        initOpen - The new value of the initial open flag.

        java.lang.String getContents()

      • setIconName

        void setIconName(java.lang.String iconName)
        Sets the name of the icon for this annotation. Should be one of:
        • Text.ICON_NOTE - This is the default
        • Text.ICON_COMMENT
        • Text.ICON_KEY
        • Text.ICON_HELP
        • Text.ICON_NEWPARAGRAPH

        • Text.ICON_STAR
        • Text.ICON_UP_ARROW
        • Text.ICON_UP_LEFT_ARROW
        Parameters:
        iconName - Name of the icon.

      • getCreationDate

        java.util.Date getCreationDate()
        Returns the date and time when the annotation was created. Milliseconds are always zero since the PDF date format doesn't support milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The date and time when the annotation was created.
